skill.name: skill-developer
skill.description: Create and manage Claude Code skills following Anthropic best practices. Use when creating new skills, modifying skill-rules.json, understanding trigger patterns, working with hooks, debugging skill activation, or implementing progressive disclosure. Covers skill structure, YAML frontmatter, trigger types (keywords, intent patterns, file paths, content patterns), enforcement levels (block, suggest, warn), hook mechanisms (UserPromptSubmit, PreToolUse), session tracking, and the 500-line rule.

content.user_title: Create and manage Claude Code skills
content.value_statement: Claude Code skills provide automated guidance and enforcement. This skill teaches you to create auto-activating skills with triggers, hooks, and guardrails to improve AI assistant behavior.
actual_capabilities: Create skill files with YAML frontmatter and proper structure
Configure trigger patterns (keywords, intent, file paths, content)
Implement guardrail and domain skill types with enforcement levels
Set up UserPromptSubmit and PreToolUse hooks for automation
Add skip conditions (session tracking, file markers, env vars)
Follow the 500-line rule and progressive disclosure pattern
limitations: Skill applies only to Claude Code environment
Requires Claude Code restart for configuration changes
Cannot modify skill behavior at runtime
Content patterns may cause false positives if not carefully designed

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines using progressive disclosure with reference files
Include all trigger keywords in description for auto-activation
Use specific intent patterns to reduce false positives
Test patterns with real prompts before deployment
anti_patterns: Using overly generic keywords that trigger on unrelated topics
Making intent patterns too broad causing false positives
Putting all content in SKILL.md instead of using reference files
Skipping content patterns when technology-specific detection is needed

faq.question: What is the difference between guardrail and domain skills?
faq.answer: Guardrail skills use enforcement: 'block' to prevent edits until skill is used. Domain skills use 'suggest' to provide guidance without blocking workflow.

faq.question: How many trigger patterns should a skill have?
faq.answer: Include all relevant keywords, 2-5 intent patterns, and 3-10 file or content patterns. More patterns mean slower matching.

faq.question: Can skills integrate with existing tools?
faq.answer: Yes. Hooks can call external scripts and tools. PreToolUse hooks run before tool execution and can block or allow operations.

faq.question: Is my skill data stored securely?
faq.answer: Skills are local markdown files. Session state is stored in .claude/hooks/state/ with session ID isolation. No data leaves your machine.

faq.question: Why is my skill not triggering on edits?
faq.answer: Check file path patterns match the actual file location. Verify content patterns match file content. Test with debug commands provided in TROUBLESHOOTING.md.

faq.question: How does this compare to Claude Code's native prompts?
faq.answer: Skills provide deeper integration with auto-activation, guardrails that block, and session-aware enforcement. Native prompts offer basic context injection without automation.
